alert.note: Alert for Borden; Howard; Scurry (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Midland-Odessa (Western Texas and Southeastern New Mexico)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued May 18 at 6:19PM CDT until May 18 at 7:00PM CDT by NWS Midland-Odessa
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 PM CDT THIS EVENING FOR SOUTHEASTERN BORDEN, NORTHEASTERN HOWARD AND SOUTHWESTERN SCURRY COUNTIES... At 619 PM CDT, Rainfall estimates show between 2 and 3 inches has fallen. Additional rainfall amounts up to 0.5 inches are possible in the warned area. Rainfall has largely ended, though some low water crossings may continue to see minor flooding over the next hour as the rain drains out. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... J B Thomas Reservoir and Knapp. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
